intro: Calysaccion ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaved calysaccion, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with oval-shaped leaflets and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
